description: Nova currently checks for the 'admin' role when trying to determine if a user is an adminstrator. When using keystone roles are returned as IDs. We should update nova so that there is a configurable keystone admin ID that is used to perform this check.
title: update keystone role check to use IDs

comments.content: Nova currently checks for the 'admin' role when trying to determine if a user is an adminstrator. When using keystone roles are returned as IDs. We should update nova so that there is a configurable keystone admin ID that is used to perform this check.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content:
Talked about this on IRC. Looks like keystone needs an update so the implementation matches the SPEC:

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/content/common/samples/validatetoken.json

We either need to get roles back as strings or update nova to check for the role ID. I'd prefer to use the role names as well so this one may be invalid.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince
